intro: Lappula costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican lappula, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forest floors and along stream banks. It features small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish or reddish in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinct botanical appearance.
